string.text: Go on…
What?

So, your first fight? Well then, remember: your opponent is a piece of meat just like you. He's here because of debts and he only has two options: to come out and fight or to land himself in the nearest anomaly. You getting the picture? He's gonna sell his life dearly. \nEquipment for today... lemme think... OK! Why don't you two use a couple of Makarovs...two clips each should be plenty. Either you kick his arse or you we feed you to the dogs - the choice is yours. Go on now.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

You last fight didn't mean shit, you understand? You're still the same piece of meat you were before and no self-respecting stalker will bet a single mag on you. If you wanna make some proper cash you're gonna have to make a few more appearances in the arena. \nYour new opponent also got through the first round and his fight was a lot harder than yours. I don't like him to be honest - he kills too quickly and the crowd don't like that. OK, now go on and show us what you can do! The bets will increase after this fight. Move it!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, well mate... I'll tell you it straight, I thought you were a pussy at first. Now it's time for you to be in a real fight. \nYou're up against two guys. The first one's called Swede and I don't remember the second one's name. They were paired up intentionally as they hate each other's guts so don't worry about them working as a team. Today is rifle day so don't let them get too close or we'll have to mop you up with a broom and dustpan. The odds are 10:1 so if you win you'll make a fair amount, got it? Off you go!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well mate, you're a fighter, a real fighter. I'm impressed. \nNow you're gonna have to work as part of a team. You get to fight with two others on your side...they're brothers so I had to put them into a team fight even tho' they're total rookies. I wouldn't expect any real help from them if I were you. You're fighting an experienced team, they're contenders for the final this season. Dangerous lot. They use different weapons: most of them have AK-74s but one has an automatic shotgun and that thing is a beast, believe you me. Good luck, mate... you're gonna need it.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

You've got a special fight today. Can you believe this shit, even the army has heard about you! Don't be surprised, they fight here too - there's even a general in the crowd...\nAnyway, I was saying - you're up against two guys from OMON. They're well armed and their armour is good as you'd expect so keep that in mind but don't worry, I ain't gonna leave you out to dry either. You'll get a vest that Freedom use - it's light so it won't slow you down. Go on, show them that stalkers ain't no whipping boys. Good luck!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Time for you to show what you can do. Duty captured a group of bandits that had been causing problems for stalkers in the Wild Territory. They did it pretty well and most of the bandits were taken alive. They were all gonna be executed anyway so I had a word with someone who knows someone... \nTo make a long story short you're about to meet them. If any of them survive they'll go to the can outside the Zone, which is better than dying here. They're not armed very well - just a few pistols and sawn-offs - but there's six of them so watch yourself. Go on now!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

Well, you owe me a drink, my friend! You're almost in the final. \nNow you'll be fighting a real pro. He's alone but he's got an F2000 and he's inside an exoskeleton. Catch one burst and you're toast. He's got another trick up his sleeve too...but I can't tell you about it. Here's my advice: be prepared, it's gonna be tough. The winner makes it through to the final.
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.

That's it mate, you're in the final! Hard to believe, eh?\nOne more to go and this one is to the death, every man for himself. There will be 4 stalkers in the arena: all real pros in exoskeletons with G36s but it's a fair deal this time - you'll get exactly what they have. The only thing is, you don't get medkits or bandages in a fight to the death. Ready? Go prove you're the best, mate!
I'm ready.
I'm not ready.
Hey! I've got a new fight for you.
Go have a drink or something, the Arena ain't ready yet.
You've already become a pro!\n
You win! Here's your reward - you earned it.\nBy the way, don't forget your things - I put them in the box.
You're not experienced enough for this fight.

Hello, meat! If you haven't fought in the Arena you're meat and that's what you'll remain! Remember: you're a piece of meat, mate! The good thing is that this problem ain't hard to solve. Fight and prove that you're a real man! \nThe rules are as simple as it gets. Two pieces of meat... sometimes more... enter the Arena and try to beat their opponent by any means available. Whoever is standing at the end - wins. The loser is fed to the blind dogs. A weapon is chosen for every round but the fighters only find out what it is right before the fight. Don't worry tho', we don't send anyone into the Arena without some firepower. Your things will fit perfectly in this box, the one next to me...\nSo whaddaya say, meat?
Here is the flash drive professor Kruglov gave me.
Good boy. I think Duty will be very grateful for this info. Here is your reward.

Well, well. Information? From professor Kruglov, who gave it to you himself? \n"I am professor Kruglov and I am deleting reports about our research for the sake of science and humanity..." And this is the info you were supposed to get!? You think Duty will be happy to get this flash drive?! This ain't funny, funny man...
I accomplished my mission. Here is Tyrant's PDA.
Wow, Marked One. Great job! You really made me happy, man, that ain't no lie. I wasn't sure you'd manage to be honest…but you surprised me mate!
What about my reward?
Here. It's all there as agreed.
Here is Lucky's PDA. I did what you asked.
Well, Marked One, what can I say? You really helped an old man out, that's for sure.
What about the reward?
You're a hero man, a real hero. Here, should make you happy.
You got any special jobs?
No, I ain't got nothing today. 0
Cut to the chase. What do I gotta do?
No, I ain't got nothing today. 1

I've got a serious mission. A group of veteran killers has showed up in the Wild Territory again. Some Duty people came to me and asked me to deal with these veterans. Duty has solid proof that they are responsible for the deaths of solo stalkers. The problem is that these veterans and Duty have some old agreement and Duty can't break it but these guys are really pushing it. Basically, Duty wants 'em taken out, nice and quiet. It ain't gonna be easy but the job is worth a lot of dough.
Anything else? Seems strange that Duty is letting them get away with it.
Duty values its reputation, which is why they need this thing done quietly. All you gotta do is kill their leader - Lucky - and bring me his PDA as proof.
I'll do it. I hope I don't regret taking this on tho'.
Good decision, mate. There ain't nothing to regret about it.
No, I'm not up for it.
Up to you but remember that this is a good opportunity to earn Duty's gratitude.
Cut to the chase. What do I gotta do?

Your mission is to kill Tyrant, the leader of the Mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. Bring me Tyrant's PDA and the reward is yours.
I'll do it. I hope I don't regret taking this on tho'.
Good decision, mate. There ain't nothing to regret about it.
No, I'm not up for it.
As you wish.
No, I ain't got nothing today. 2

Your mission is to kill Tyrant, the leader of the Mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. Bring me Tyrant's PDA and the reward is yours.
I'll do it. I hope I don't regret taking this on tho'.
Good decision, mate. There ain't nothing to regret about it.
No, I'm not up for it.
As you wish.
No, I ain't got nothing today. 3
Don't rush, Marked One. You are looking for more work but you haven't even dealt with the veterans yet…
No, nothing today.

I've got a serious job. A group of veteran killers has showed up in the Wild Territory again. Some people from Duty paid me a visit... basically they have proof that these killers are implicated in murdering lone stalkers but it's a messed up situation really. I think these bandits have some old pact with Duty that ain't worth breaking. Problem is, these veterans are really pushing it so they need to be dealt with...quietly. It's a difficult task but the game is worth the candle.
Anything else?
Duty has a reputation to uphold so they want this to be real low-profile. Just whack their leader - Lucky - and bring me his PDA to prove that you've done it.
OK, I'll do it.
Great! You won't regret it.
No, I'm not up for it.
Your choice… It's a good chance to do Duty a favour. They'll be grateful.
text in default

The job is to kill Tyrant, the Mercenaries' leader. They've fought their way into the Wild Territory and set up shop at the construction site. Be careful - they're experienced fighters and they would have set up sentries around the site. If you bring me Tyrant's PDA... I doubt you'll be disappointed.
I'll do it.
Great! You won't regret it.
No, I'm not up for it.
As you wish.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, nothing today.
No, I ain't got nothing today. 4
Not yet, next time.
I got a job for a pro.
Cut to the chase. What do I gotta do?

Your mission is to kill Tyrant, the leader of the Mercenaries. His crew made it into the Wild Territory and set up a base at the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes on the way to the site. Bring me Tyrant's PDA and the reward is yours.
I'll do it. I hope I don't regret taking this on tho'.
Good decision, mate. There ain't nothing to regret about it.
No, I'm not up for it.
As you wish.
No, I'm not interested right now.
No, I ain't got nothing today. 1
No, I ain't got nothing today. 2
No, I ain't got nothing today. 3
No, I ain't got nothing today. 2
No, I ain't got nothing today. 3
Let's start. You ready?
Hmm… Where did you come from?
So Marked One, you got the documents from X16?
Yeah. Here.
No.
Goddammit! Here I am, trying my arse off while you're off wandering the woods! Go get those damn documents or we won't make any progress!
OK.
Well, now we just need to deal with the Burner and open the way north! Can you go right now?
Yeah.

OK, Marked One. You've got the protective prototype which should keep you safe from the Burner and I know where the instrument panel is. Just don't forget: the prototype is exactly that, a prototype so it won't protect you forever. Get your arse inside the bunker underneath the antennae and turn this thing off ASAP! \nGod knows what will happen... but I've got a feeling it's gonna be worth it. The main thing is that the way to the Zone's centre will be open.
Go on.
All we gotta do is get to the antennae when the emission level drops and turn 'em off. Got it?
Got it.
No, I'm not ready yet.
What are you on about? This shit can't wait!

OK... The documents you brought back from the Institute clear a few things up but we still don't have enough info. The files mention some lab called X18 and its description sounds a lot like those underground rooms in the Dark Valley. \nLooks like you'll have to go there and find the missing information. The lab is locked and you'll need two electronic keys to get in. I have one but you'll have to take the other one off Boar in the Dark Valley.
Go on.

All you need to do now is get the second key to X18, get inside and get the missing documents. Don't forget about the radiation - you won't last a minute there without a decent suit.\nSo, Marked One, will you do it?
I'll try.
That's great! Come back in one piece.
No, I don't want to do it yet.
Up to you but remember: this is the way we can open the road north.
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still the same grumpy loner. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll cheer up a bit…
So, you got the documents, Marked One?
Here, take them.

Well, well... here we go! The situation is becoming a bit clearer. Just as I thought, the Burner didn't appear all by itself. Wanna know what it is? It's a Kaimanov emitter...whatever that is. They made parts for it at X18.\nNow we need to find out how we can avoid being affected by it. There's a reference here... something called X16 where they sent units that were ready. Umm... here it is! It's located in the former production facility by Amber Lake. The scientists are digging around there at the moment, I'm sure they can tell us more.
Go on.
It's not an easy situation. You have to make it through to the scientists and find out where lab X16 is located. The missing documents are there. \nYou ready for it?
Yeah.
Great! I'll wait for you.
No, I'm not ready yet.
Well get ready real quick Marked One! This sort of business can't wait.
No.
What are you wasting time for? Go get those damn documents or we won't make any progress!
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still the same grumpy loner. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll cheer up a bit…
Hey, Marked One! Did you bring the documents from the Institute?
No, I haven't got the docs from the Institute yet.

That ain't good, Marked One, ain't good at all... You understand how much we need 'em, don'tcha? We need 'em bad, believe you me. The Brain Burner is right under our noses but we don't even know what it is! Go get the documents right now - we'll talk after.
I hope I do understand.
Here they are.

Great work, Marked One. At last we have them. I need to read 'em now... maybe I'll find out how to get north... While I do that, you go speak to the head of Duty's guards and find out about the rules on their turf while you're at it. Once you've done that, come back here - I should have all this figured out by then.
OK.
What do you want, Marked One?
Hey, Marked One! Times change but you're still the same grumpy loner. Here, take a seat, have a drink - maybe you'll cheer up a bit…
I want to know something.
What is it?
Thank you.
What do you know about Sharpshooter?
An experienced stalker as far as I know. He used the northern exits from the Zone so he was never seen here. There are rumours that he took his group right into the centre.
What do you know about a stalker they call Ghost?

He's one of Sharpshooter's men. They say he can sneak in anywhere...hence the name. I heard it was him that took out the leader of some group... what was the name? Ah, Final Day, that's the one. They were pretty wild those boys... Oh, by the way, I heard that Ghost is doing some job for the scientists so if you're looking for him try by Amber Lake.
He's an old stalker in retirement. He lives in the marshes, I'll mark it on the map for you. He used to be in Sharpshooter's group in his day.
What do you know about Fang?
There was a man that went by that name… He was a bit weird, that's for sure - talked to himself and stuff…but he was OK apart from that. I haven't seen him around here for ages.
Tell me about the mobile science labs.

People on the outside set them up for the scientists in different parts of the Zone from time to time. They're like isolated metal bunkers with everything you need to live for a few weeks inside. We're in contact with one of these labs at Amber. Scientists are good guys - they tell us a lot of interesting things and we help them out when we can. An exchange of sorts...
What is the Wish-granting machine?
O! That's an interesting question… I wish I knew the answer. I can tell you the legend about it if you want but you make up your own mind how much truth there's in it.
Very interesting.

I better start with the Monolith. It's some weird thing...no one really knows what it is or where it came from... maybe it's what caused the Zone to appear. When the station exploded in 2006 they tried to evacuate as many people as possible straight away. Everyone is panicking, nobody knows what's going on, the Zone is blocked off by the army on all sides but it's growing like it's alive! The field decontamination labs can't cope... \nIn the end, loads of people died and the whole of Europe was crapping its pants, afraid that the radiation might reach them. Not even a year had passed and already some brave guys and a few greedy ones appeared, calling themselves stalkers. They quietly snuck through army cordons and started bringing very strange things out of the Zone. There was a lot of interest in them and scientists went after them like crazy - whole institutes would squabble over good items. At first they paid huge money for just one trinket..how things change...
Go on…

After a while, the first tales and legends started appearing that talked about what's deep inside the Zone by the semi-destroyed nuclear station. It was then that one of the veterans told us the story of the Monolith that supposedly grants your wishes. You should have seen the hysteria: experienced, level-headed men started trying to break through to the centre in groups - everyone wanted something from the Monolith. All because of some story about the first stalker who made it there...a sad story if you ask me...
Go on… tell me more.

When the second Zone had just appeared many people were cordoned off. Most of them died pretty quickly, of course, but there were a few lucky ones who survived... they tried to get out somehow and became the first stalkers, in a way. This one guy was trying to go around some anomalies and found himself by the station: there was no way back so he decided to try to get through the ruins. All of a sudden he saw some light - he assumed it was coming from a little camp fire. When he got a little closer he saw that it was coming through a small crack in the Sarcophagus. And the thing is, he knew it couldn't have been a fire but started climbing up for some reason. There was a hole at the top and through it he could see a massive black rock... or maybe not a rock, no one knows...but he could see it and what's more it's shape was... perfect. It was the Monolith. The guy managed to wake himself up right before he fell in. He got a hell of a shock: first of all, he nearly killed himself, secondly he climbed into the most radioactive place on the planet and third, it called to him. The Monolith called to him and called his name. It called to him and told him that it is the Monolith and what it can do...
Jesus…

I don't know what's true and what's not about the story but the point is the guy made a wish... and it came true. He found himself way outside the Zone and as healthy as a newborn baby but the Zone's size increased by a few kilometres that night too and a few army cordons got a good doze of R. That part is true for sure, I remember it myself... It seems the Zone eats more land for every wish that is granted... But that ain't gonna stop hotshots like you, is it?
I am more interested in other things at the moment.
It's your business, man. What exactly do you want to know?
Hic… goddammit! Yes, I'm drunk, I'm drunk! They wanna…they… wanna kick me out of Duty if I fail this task too…you know? But I'm not…hic…not feeling too…hic…good at the moment…you know?
I feel for you.
What's up? Any news? \nYou haven't whacked the little piece of shit, I can see it in your eyes. Life sucks… Listen, at least have a drink with me, will you, friend?
Maaan…hic…you… you… you really saved… saved me! I'll never forget it! Let's drink to Duty!
I found it. Here is your rifle.

Wow?! You found my rifle?! I'm lost for words, man! Thank you so much! I'm so grateful! You really helped me out there, you really did. God damn. Here take this... it ain't much but it's all I got. \nListen, I'll tell you something. There's a boarded up house next to that place where you got my rifle. Nobody knows what's really inside it but you can see through the windows that there are anomalies there, lots of them. There might be artifacts in there too... I don't know how to get there tho'.
Go on.
Help me out, man! I've lost my rifle by that place where those damn bloodsuckers live and they're not friendly… If I don't get it back, I'm in trouble. I'll send you the co-ordinates...
OK, I'll try to get your rifle.
I'm not lying, man!
I don't think you are - it's not in your interest to lie to me.
No. I've got more important things to do.
Up to you… but I hope you change your mind.
We'll see.

I've got a big problem man! I... I lost my weapon in the Wild Territory. I wanted to shoot some bloodsuckers but I barely got away. Damn! Listen, bro'... if you get it back I'll pay you. I've made a little cash here and I'll give you all of it, just get my rifle back. It's a family rifle, you know, passed from father to son... And I lost it!
Hey! \nAny news? Did you find it?!
Thanks bro'! I'll never forget that you helped me!
Wolfhound said you've got something for me.
Sure. Here is a grenade launcher attachment for helping him with Kruglov and a little cash on top. I'll give you some useful info for free to sweeten the deal too.
Thank you.

Here's what I got to say. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom and Duty has you in its sights. I'd say you oughtta go to the abandoned military base and join Freedom - they need good fighters. There will be more shootouts between the groups soon and whoever chooses the right side won't regret it.
I work as a trafficker of information. I sell important info and buy charts, documents and lab records. Want to know something? General information is free!

Hello, Marked One. You helped Freedom and made the right choice. Your fate is now tied with that of Freedom and Duty has you in its sights. I'd suggest you go to the abandoned military base and join Freedom - they need good fighters.
I'll think about it.
So Marked One, what brings you here? Wanna buy some info or are you selling today?
So you're connected with Freedom then?
I can't answer that question right now. What I will say is that I am not a member of any group.
Tell me about Freedom.

Sure, no problem! Freedom is one of the oldest groups in the Zone and the only one that openly opposes government troops and research teams. Its founders are dead - they were killed during a big bloodbath after the army dropped a large assault force in the Zone but the ability to control the Zone from outside was destroyed at the same time. There is some evidence to say that the first Zone was used as a secret army weapons testing site for trying out new weaponry. If that's true it must be some powerful shit.\nAnyway, what was I saying...? Oh yeah, Freedom is the only group that is trying to stop the government from getting control over the testing site again. God knows what will happen if they start testing their shit again so Freedom is trying to hold out at all costs.
What about Duty?

Duty is basically the vanguard of government forces. Not everyone knows this but Duty is controlled from the outside. Their current objective is to clear the territory of mutants and destroy Freedom...and to generally "keep their finger on the pulse". When the time is right they'll drop a new assault force in the Zone which will take control of the area.
Thanks for the information.
I want to buy some information.
Right now I can sell you information about a modified SVU. The price is very low as usual - four thousand.
OK, I'll buy it.

OK, I know where...or, actually, on who you can find an excellent modification of a sniper rifle. According to my information, there's some guy called Max in the middle of Freedom's base. Don't expect it to be easy, he's not just gonna give it up... on the other hand you can try to lure him out of the camp. Anything found on a corpse belongs to the man who found it so bear that in mind... \n\n
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come to the bar when you decide otherwise - I'm always here.
Right now I have some information about a modified AN-94. Two thousand it'll cost ya.
OK, I'll buy it.

It's true that a standard AN-94 is known for it's accuracy but the kick on it ain't no joke... Well, anyway, there's a modified version in the Zone which currently belongs to the leader of a small group of mercenaries. The increased weight of this baby means the recoil is basically non-existent so draw your own conclusions. You can find this group at the Cordon - I heard they have some business at the rookie camp. Look for them around there soon and you won't miss 'em.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you. Come back when you change your mind.
I've got some info about a modified Beretta. The price is three and a half Gs.
Deal.

A Beretta is a real weapon for a real pro. You won't go wrong with this beauty anyway but a modified one is quite something - size matters and all that... Scientists aren't normally good with their hands but there's a craftsman among them who made it even better. The beast is even more powerful now and only a blind drunk would miss with it. You can find it in the scientists' bunker by Amber, obviously. Good luck.\n\n
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you, mate.
I can share some info with you about an LR-300. It'll cost you three thousand.
OK.

There was this guy, he was a real gunsmith, you know? He produced a lot of really special items and the last thing he made was the modified LR-300, an attempt to make a sort of sniper rifle out of an automatic. It was made to order for Freedom - they never have the money for normal weapons. \nSo these three Freedom guys went to test the new weapon in a village full of bloodsuckers and obviously none of them came back. Their mates got a touch upset and didn't spend a long time looking for the guilty... that was the end of the gunsmith alright. So if you want the rifle, go to the village by the warehouses and look for it there.
No, I changed my mind.
Up to you.
I've got some fresh info about a modified mercenary suit! I'll do you a favour and sell you the information for only five thousand.
I'm listening.

OK, well there is some guy called Ara the Mercenary in the Zone. He sells info just like me but he also deals in other stuff... I don't trade in weapons or people, for example. He's got a great suit purpose-made for raids into the Zone. It would take too long to describe it in detail. Just find Ara and you'll see it yourself...the problem is, it's usually neigh on impossible to find the slippery bastard. Now, here's the thing - he's doing some business at the warehouses at the moment so look for him there. My advice: go do some work for Freedom - they're bound to know something.
No, I changed my mind.
As you wish, man.
I don't have any new information at the moment.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Useful to a rookie? Well listen then, rookie!\nTo the north, not far from the Brain Burner, Freedom have set up their HQ in an old military base. They're notorious nihilists, anarchists and criminals - freedom fighters, freaking Che Guevaras all of them. All they do is sabotage research groups, attack army units and constantly skirmish with Duty. Let me give you some advice: never get involved with them. They'll only accept you if you're totally crazy and there's a reward on your head anyway. How's that for useful, rookie?
Thanks for your advice.

Duty... sounds good. Ex-military, deserve respect. They consider it their, heh, duty to protect the world from mutants. Modern vampire hunters only they don't care about little things like our Wild Territory - they want large concentrations of mutants... hotshots… They only accept veterans because they don't sit around... they clean.
They clean what? Their trousers? I'm only joking… They really deserve respect.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

What to tell you... Well, there used to be this group led by Sharpshooter. There were all sorts of legends about it going around the Zone...good and bad, but few people really knew the truth. The truth is that they wanted to deal with the Zone, find out what created it. That's why military stalkers were after them but they didn't know where to look for them. The government didn't want normal stalkers to know things they shouldn't have known. One day Sharpshooter found something really important and made a move towards the centre of the Zone with some of his boys. Half of the group died on the way but the rest made it through... What happened to them there - no one knows. They disappeared and nobody has heard from them. The others were caught and killed off... I don't think there are any of them left now. Sad story, eh?
Yeah… looks like someone really doesn't want the Zone to be understood…
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

Remember: mercenaries aren't even Freedom, they're worse... At least Freedom has an idea but these dogs, they'll do anything for money. Someone really needs to kill 'em all before they drag something really dangerous out of the Zone into the normal world! They're based in the Dead City... there's a sniper in every tall building, understand? They don't like strangers - strangers get their head blown off!
I see, looks like you have to be careful in the Dead City.
What do you want?
Can you tell me anything that would be useful to a rookie?

If you haven't been in the Arena I'd recommend it - it's a good way to make money and show everyone what you can do. Not everyone has the balls to fight there but if you enter the Arena everyone knows you're a real man! Man, as soon as I save up enough cash for decent armour...
What do you want?
Are you Baldy? I need to talk to you.
Suppose I am. What do you want?
Spotty got saved from the Radar, that's what but Hunchback is dead.
Goddammit!
Spotty is in a bad way, his brain don't work for shit. Maybe you can talk to him? We need to find out the Burner's schedule.

No! Don't ask me to do this. Hunchback is dead 'cause of me and what happened to Spotty is my fault too. I left them, betrayed them, deserted them and ran away! I can't look Spotty in the eye after what I did!
C'mon, chill man. Tell me what happened.

The three of us were getting ready to try to get through to the north. We didn't know the times when the Burner emissions are lower but Spotty managed to get the info somewhere...I don't know where... We were half-way through the sector when the Burner suddenly switched on again. Spotty passed out straight away and fell down the hillside. I panicked and said that we should leave everything and go back. Hunchback managed to pull himself together and said that we gotta get Spotty out... I said "You're an idiot, don't you wanna live? It's over for him, how are we gonna carry him all the way back?" Just as he managed to convince me and started to climb down to get Spotty... another wave came. By the time I came to my senses I was by the military base... I thought Hunchback and Spotty were left there... but he got him out and didn't make it himself... he got him out...
OK, Baldy, OK. Calm down, man. Thanks for telling me what happened. I'll talk to Spotty myself.
Sorry, bro'. I'm not in the mood for talking… I'd rather just have another drink.
…It's about time someone whacked Boar! If I knew who it was, I'd thank him personally…
Yeah, it was about time.
…Someone really pissed off Freedom the other day: I heard one of their groups was destroyed in the Wild Territory…I wonder who might have done it?
Hah, you think they're gonna tell you just like that?
…At long last someone had the balls to clear out the bloodsuckers in the Wild Territory… What was Duty doing all this time?… Except talking...
What was Duty doing? They were doing Freedom, what else?
…I heard someone whacked the leader of Freedom. They're in for some tough times methinks. Duty is gonna really put a squeeze on 'em…
Let's hope so.

So you wiped out those stinking bandits? Well done, friend! Six stalkers went missing in that area recently...we all suspected the bandits and so did Duty but they didn't make a move for some reason. It's a good thing we've got a man with some lead in his pencil here.
Yeah, many people wanted those bandits to disappear...

You turned off the emissions in the Amber sector?! Wow...you're a lucky, skillful son of a bitch... come here, let me hug you! \nI'll be damned, someone finally managed to deal with that crap! You can't imagine how many of our boys died there... Hopefully the scientists will work out what the hell it was. Maybe we can deal with the Burner now, whaddaya think?
I want to believe that the Burner can be switched off.
What do you want? I'm trying to relax here…
What's new?

I hear Sharpshooter came back and what's more he's got all the equipment you need to get to the Machine. He's hiding now though 'cause a lot of people are after him. Some are open about it while others are trying to keep their interest a secret. Rumour has it even Duty and Freedom have joined the hunt and as usual their goals are exactly the opposite of each other.
Heh… Looks like Sharpshooter is right to hide.
What do you want?
What's new?

There was a guy... He had a lisp and walked with a stoop so he got the name Hunchback. He was a bit crazy...talked to himself and animals quite a lot... but he was alright apart from that. He disappeared a long time ago in the centre together with Sharpshooter... they say Sharpshooter is back now.
I wonder where he is now.
What do you want?
What's new?

The Wild Territory is infested with bloodsuckers now! They come out at night. There must be something really important at the factory that's nearby, something essential to someone. Duty sent some guys in there recently but they all died and their screams were heard for miles.
Thanks for the information.
What do you want?
What do you hear?

If you go around Amber Lake you'll come to the scientists' camp - they're researching something... They were dropped in by helicopter and they get regular supplies too. They've got a nice spot there really... You can deal with them too - they buy artifacts and might even give you a job to do. They paid pretty well the last I heard.
Thanks, I'll keep that in mind.
What do you want?
What do you hear?

What could be new here? Nobody has managed to get through the vehicle graveyard because of the Brain Burner. Someone did see a stalker go past the border, fall over, then get up in a couple of minutes and head straight for the middle of Dump. He ain't been seen since...
Interesting…
What do you want?
What do you hear?

Some missing stalkers have come back recently. It's a scary sight, I tell you: they mumble something and reach for their weapons, which they lost somewhere... One came to a Duty post some time ago and a crowd gathered to look at him. Someone even recognised him... He was scary...red eyes, all bloodshot and bruised...couldn't say a word, just moaned like an animal and went around in circles. Duty took him in, gave him some meds but he died after a couple of days anyway. Something happens to people in the Zone but what is it?
I'd like to know too.
What do you want?
What do you hear?

What's new? You sure you wanna hear it? There are a lot of zombie "empties" around Amber Lake. They wander in circles and attack any human they see. If you're spotted you might wanna run for your life - there are too many of them former stalkers around there... They died at the lake and those "empties" are all that's left of 'em...
Yeah, I wouldn't wish their fate on anyone.
What do you want?
What do you hear?

Well, I heard traders saying that there's a real treasure trove of artifacts in the centre of the Zone so anyone who makes it through will make enough money for two lifetimes.\nPersonally, though I think there's more to it than that. Obviously the traders think about their own interests but there are some rumours going around... There's something better than artifacts there - something that ain't from this world, something alien or from another dimension altogether! They call it the Wish-granting machine. I heard a story about a stalker who made it through and his wish was granted. Only every time someone makes a wish the Zone grows and nobody who gets there uses his wish to make it disappear. I guess when you get to the Machine you don't give a shit about anyone else...
That's sad.
What do you want?
What do you hear?

You know that everyone who believes in the Monolith is completely nuts? They keep banging on about it but nobody actually knows what's in the centre of the Zone. A dark crystal that fell from the skies...ha-ha-ha! I reckon one of the secret labs blew up - I mean some stalkers used to work in a few of them. \nBut bombing the Zone is obviously stupid. Not only will the radiation spread all over the world, half the country will be flattened. "Someone" has gone totally mad lately - I heard they're killing normal stalkers for no reason at all. How do you like that? Damn fanatics...
I think it deserves some attention.
I want to join Duty. What do I need to do?
Pay a fee of one thousand. You'll get a pass. Take that to Voronin in the bunker and he'll arrange a test for you.
OK, here you go.
Right, here is your pass. Go see General Voronin with it. I've marked it on your map.
No, I changed my mind.
Your choice, man.
Because there is no place for those Freedom bandits in the Zone - they must be destroyed. If you're interested go ask the barman to explain everything. I'm busy.
Pay 1000 rubles as your fee and you'll get a pass. Take that to the Duty administrator and he'll arrange tests for you.
OK, here's the money.
That's great, here's your pass. Take it to Petrenko, the administrator - I've marked it on the map.
No, I changed my mind.
It's up to you, man. See you.
The Barman said I should say "hello" and find out the rules.

The Barman was right. So, one more new guy? Well, that's good, new people are what we want!\n The rules are simple. First rule: shooting is not permitted on our territory. Break this rule more than once and all our patrols will open fire on sight. Behave and you won't have any problems.
What's rule number 2?
The second rule is: the Duty base is closed to non-members. Anyone who attempts to get in will be shot immediately.
That's clear. Anything else?

That's about it. If you want to try to join Duty, feel free. We need good men but I warn you: before being accepted you'll have to do a few dangerous jobs. We don't need pussies so everyone is tested.
Stop! Outsiders aren't allowed in Duty's base!
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on, bro'. Remember: Duty's mission is to put an end to the Zone.
Why don't you let outsiders in?
Where did you come from, day-dreamer? There's a war going on, right? We’re fighting mutants and Freedom bandits!
A war with Freedom? Why?
Because there is no place for bandits neither in society nor here. They must be destroyed. If you're interested go talk to the barman - he'll explain it to you…
Stop! Only members can go in there! We can't let you in without a special pass. If you want to get one go see Colonel Petrenko. He's in the administration area, across the yard.
What are you standing there for? Keep moving.
Go on. Remember our mission!
What do you want?
I'm listening.
Hello, brother.
What can I do for Duty?

That's a good question, Marked One and there's an equally good answer to it - kill Freedom anarchists. You'll get a reward for every PDA of theirs you bring and you might get promoted too. Take all the PDAs you get to Petrenko - he gives out the rewards.
I want to join the Duty ranks.

A commendable wish. However before we let you join I would like to give you a job. Not for Duty but for me personally. We are currently conducting large scale operations against Freedom in the vicinity. We don't have enough heavy weaponry while the enemy has several RG-6 grenade launchers. It would really help us if someone infiltrated Freedom's base and got at least one of these grenade launchers. Let me give you a little hint: you're not a member of Duty so it's easy for you to earn their trust and, if you're lucky, acquire the necessary weapons.
Go on.

I'll upload the location of Freedom's base for you. You'll need to find someone called Chef - he knows where the grenade launchers are kept. He likes his booze so take that on board and bring a bottle of vodka with you.\n So, will you do it?
OK, I will.

Oh, and one more thing. Colonel Skull and his boys disobeyed my order and decided to attack Freedom's base without authorisation. Well, they can reap what they sow... suicidal bastards. Don't get involved in their fight, just try to get me the grenade launcher - nothing else matters.\n
I'm not ready for such exploits just yet.
Up to you.
I am ready to swear the oath.
Good man. \nRepeat after me: "I, a stalker known as the Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty..."
I, a stalker known as the Marked One, swear to defend the goals and ideals of Duty…
"To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns on its territory and beyond its borders..."
To protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone, to seek out and destroy anything it spawns on its territory and beyond its borders...
"To fight any nonconformists be they individual stalkers or groups..."
To fight any nonconformists be they individual stalkers or groups...
"And to give my life in the name of justice and order should such a sacrifice be required!"
And to give my life in the name of justice and order should such a sacrifice be required!
Congratulations! You're now a full member of Duty.
I completed the mission.
Good. That's exactly what we need right now.\nWell, Marked One, you passed the test and I'll be glad to accept you into Duty.
I'm listening.
What brings you here?
You have the grenade launcher?
Yes, here it is.
Well, Marked One, you passed the test and I'll be glad to accept you into Duty.
So, rookie, are you ready to swear your oath of allegiance to Duty?
The war with Freedom is coming to an end, Marked One. You played your part in fighting for the cause! Now I want to finish this war. The leader of our enemies must be disposed of.
Marked One, you killed the anarchists' leader and the enemy is crumbling. The war is not over but its outcome is certain. Your achievements are great and they will not be forgotten.
Hello, stalker. Have you thought about joining Duty? We need good fighters! I only joined recently and look at the cool equipment I've been issued with!
Hello, Marked One. I'm glad you're with us. Duty is really going to need good fighters soon.
Hey fellow stalker.
Tell me about Duty.

We've been here from the beginning. The first group was made up of surviving officers and soldiers from special units sent into the Zone to find out what caused it to appear. Most of the personnel deployed for the operation died and those who survived swore that they will not leave here until they understand what is going on in the Zone. Until they defeat it.
Tell me about Freedom.

They're thugs who don't understand that the Zone is an ulcer on the planet's body. They want to spread it all over the world, a piece in every household. They'll do anything to achieve the aims. I can't wait till we end them.
You want to defeat the Zone?
Yes and we partly manage. During Duty clearing operations whole swarms of mutants are destroyed on the way to the Zone's centre.
Thank you.
I'm listening.
How can I help?
Hello! What happened?
What do you want?
Go on, keep moving. What are you staring at?
Hey, man! I'm glad you haven't been eaten by mutants yet.
There was some slaughter by the post. What happened?

That's the last wave of mutants that came before the emission. It's quiet for three or four days and then they come again. If not for us, there'd be no Bar, there'd be no Duty; we're the last barrier in the mutants' way. A lot of our boys met their end here...
I'd like to know something.
What do you want to know?
It's my first time here. Could you tell me a little about this place?

Before the first accident this was an industrial area. As you can see, there ain't much left of it now... In the basement by the hangar you'll find the "100 roentgen" bar: the place is run by the local trader who doubles up as a barman. Stalkers come there from all over the Zone - if you want to trade, talk or find out the latest news it's the place to go. There's also the Arena where you can fight and make some cash. Duty's base is not far from the Arena. If you want to join Duty go straight over there - they'll tell you who to speak to. Oh, by the way, all of this area is protected by Duty so behave and keep your weapons holstered.
You said there's a bar here. Can you tell me where it is, exactly?
In the basement behind the hangar…I'll mark it on your map.
Thanks for the information.
You said Duty's base is here. How do I get there?
It's near the Arena. I've marked it on the map for you.
Thanks for the information.
You said there's an Arena here? Where is it, exactly?
Look: go past the hangar with the broken roof and you'll end up right in front of it. I'll mark it on your map just to make sure.
Thanks for the information.
Thanks for the information.
I'm here on business.
Your sly little face tells me that you want something from me!
I shot a pig down on my way here. They say it's a valuable one.
Yeah, I've heard all about it - you shot Boar. You deserve to get some cash and a decent shooter for that. Don't dishonour your new weapon!
Don't you worry about that.
I had a little chat with Tyrant… basically, he understood he was wrong and promised to behave in the future. I'm pretty sure he won't be breaking his word.
You wasted Tyrant? Well, well… he was a real pain in the arse for us! I'm glad you talked to him. Here is your reward - an OC-14 Groza… you could say it's our trademark weapon. You earned it!
Not a bad shooter. See you.
Didn't Voronin tell you anything?
Wow, congratulations! To kill Freedom's leader - that's… that's something. Man, I wish I was half as hard as you…
Get plenty of exercise and eat your Weetabix. The main thing is always listen to your mother. \nThanks for the new equipment. I'm off.
I'd like to know something.
What exactly would you like to know, stalker?
Who are you and how did you end up here?

My name is Kruglov, professor Kruglov. I am a biologist studying the Zone. I mostly find and document new species of mutant animals, their traits and distinctive features. Yesterday, for example, I found an animal of particular interest... Where was I? Oh yes. The information is then thoroughly studied and I transfer it to the outside world or distribute it throughout the Zone, quite often through your... errr... barman. I hope my work has helped to save the lives of many stalkers. I was just transporting the results of my latest research to the laboratory near Amber when the helicopter came under fire.
Tell me about your understanding of the Zone.

Well, in my opinion the Zone is a wonderful gift to humanity. Of course normal existence here is not possible due to the large number of adverse external factors: high radiation levels, anomalies, aggressive mutants and so on... All of these things are obviously potentially dangerous but they are simultaneously items of great scientific value. The Zone is... an experiment of truly gargantuan proportions! It's a unique opportunity to make a breakthrough in many fields of science! The extent to which humanity's knowledge could be increased through studying the Zone is unfathomable. Technology, medicine, new plants (medical and edible), biotechnology, cures for incurable diseases...anything! If only people didn't interfere science could lead humanity into a new Golden Era!
However Duty thinks otherwise and even Freedom doesn't seem to want to help you.

You have to understand - they're simply incapable of grasping the whole picture in its entirety. For all stalkers, without exception, their current, personal, essentially irrelevant problems are far more important than the progress of humanity!
I'm a stalker but I don't consider studying the Zone to be pointless.

Then you understand? You also see the big picture? It's wonderful to discover that there are those among you who are not narrow-minded practical people. I've always said - it's important to look at the whole set of issues from a broader perspective, to distance ourselves from our emotions. I admit the Zone can do, and has done, harm to humanity but to reject the unique opportunities it offers would be utter nonsense!
Why are mercenaries looking for this information?

I hope this doesn't offend you... but many stalkers are in a way children - easily excitable and fickle. Just think of all these legends... about a Monolith that grants wishes. What a joke! Childish people are often annoyed about the fact that someone doesn't share everything with them, including information that is not meant for them. Unfortunately, they also have a tendency to use weapons without thinking... dangerous fools!
I am looking for laboratory X16. Could you tell me where it is?
Laboratory X16? Hmm… Sakharov mentioned something of the sort in passing but I do not recall exactly what he said. Perhaps you'd best ask him yourself... He's currently in the mobile lab by Amber.
Unfortunately I have to go. Good luck to you.
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK.
Let's move. We'll try to break through…
Let's hurry up.

Mr. Stalker, I beg you! We were returning to the Amber sector when mercenaries shot down our helicopter. I believe they are looking for information which I have with me and they'll probably kill me once they have it. Help me get to the lake and I'll tell you everything I know about a device called... stalkers call it the Brain Burner. Further, I will ask the barman to pay you.
OK, follow me.
As you say. However, please be kind enough to go first as I'm not much of a fighter…
You know what? Try to get out of here yourself.
I… I am sure you're not such an evil person. I'll never make it out of here alone. I will wait here in case you change your mind although I don't know how long I will last…
Hurry, we have to get out of here quickly.

Phew! We made it to safety? At last! \nThank you so much for your help, stalker. Please accept this flash drive as a token of my gratitude - it contains a back-up copy of information concerning the results of my latest expedition. I am sure our mutual friend, the barman, would pay for it very well.
Yes, we're here.
Excuse me… Marked One. Please come and visit our mobile laboratory. Our new suits are not bad at all… if you like them, we'll try to "lose" one.
We'll see. I won't make any promises.
Hello, stalker. Allow me to express my gratitude on behalf of the whole of global science!
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK.
Let's move. We'll try to break through…
Let's go.
Marked One, stop them or they'll kill us!
Sit tight. We'll deal with them.
OK, I'll wait here.
Let's move. We'll try to break through…
OK, let's hurry.
Be careful with anomalies, Marked One. My suit will protect me from the…err…the Scorcher but you'd best avoid it.
Thanks for your advice.
Hurry, Marked One. Now is not the time for conversations.
Stalker, talk to professor Kruglov, help him get out.
It's over. They killed Kruglov!
